intro: Cnidium chinense, commonly known as Chinese snakegrass, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its rhizomes and roots are used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits. Cnidium chinense thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
